Description: Rough brown ware pottery bowl made of dense Nile silt clay with organic temper. Diagonal finger marks on the exterior give the appearance of broad rippling. Exterior is coated with reddish-brown self-slip discoloured by several fire clouds; it is well burnished in a perpendicular direction to the rippling. Interior is scatter-burnished horizontally.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl.19.9b)
Condition: Half of vessel has been restored.
